body.directions: Listen to the audio, then complete the multiple-choice questions that follow.

body.quiz: Which of the following is a reasonable time for the meal said in the audio?
body.correct: Job well done! 早餐 zǎocān means “breakfast,” and the best time to have it is early morning.
body.incorrect: Very close. Listen to the word in the audio again, especially the first character, to understand its meaning.

body.quiz: Which of the following has the same final as the second character in the word in the audio?
body.answer: Audio for 鸡蛋 jīdàn
options: Audio for 曲奇 qǔqí
Audio for 筷子 kuàizi
Audio for 松饼 sōngbǐng
body.correct: Outstanding! The 2nd character in the word 午餐 wǔcān (lunch) has final “an,” which is the same as the 2nd character in 鸡蛋 jīdàn (egg).
body.incorrect: Not quite. Listen to the 2nd character in the word again, and consider what final it has. Then listen to the words in the options to see which one matches.

body.quiz: Which character in the word in the audio is usually omitted, and what’s its meaning?
options: None of the three characters can be omitted.
body.correct: Terrific job! The 1st character 炸 zhà in the word 炸薯条 zhà shǔtiáo (French fries) can be omitted. It means “deep-fried” by itself.
body.incorrect: Not quite. Think about the meaning of the word in the audio, and then consider the meanings of some of the characters in it.

body.quiz: Which of the following items is least likely to go with the item said in the audio during a meal?
body.correct: Wonderfully done! 汉堡 hànbǎo (Hamburger) can be eaten with a knife and fork, but it may not work well with chopsticks.
body.incorrect: Not quite. Listen to the word in the audio again, and then consider its meaning and what utensils can be used for it.
